title: What do you think of Mili's music? - Quora

response.answer_text: I LOVE Mili! Not only they had the most creative lyrics i have ever seen, their songs are not like the other existing music i have ever heard, but the first thing that made me a big fan of Mili is Momo’s vocal voice. I first discovered Mili from an android music gane called Deemo, the song was nine point eight. The first time i hear it, the vocal reminds me of some anime songs, or female japanese singer who had such “cute” voice. But the more i listened to it, i started to feel that that’s not just it. Momo has an unique voice, thats for sure. The arrangement of the song was uncommon but catchy and it gave me a feeling of “this is the new kind of music i have ever heard.” even the Instrumental songs like friction or ephemeral sounds ‘brand new’ to me. And not to mention the lyric! With such deep meaning, unique and expanded vocabularies, the multi-languages and also the made up languages. And their unique point of view on every imaginable cases that gives us songs like The Bathtub Mermaid which i believe was a twisted story of the Little Mermaid! Mili represent the music that is carefully build, full of fantasy and imagination, and is so out-of-this-world to me. Their uniqueness captivated me! P.s = my favorite is Ga1ahad and Scientific Witchery which i sing with my friend (him as Ga1ahad and me as the purple witch), and also world.execute(me); which i always sing!

Thanks for A2A Geofanny B. Yohanes To be honest I don't know much about Mili since most of my knowledge about Japanese musical artists/groups comes from anime soundtracks. Well, Mili has also made anime soundtracks but I haven't watched any of the series with their songs yet... Anyway, after hearing two of their songs on Youtube, several things come to mind: Their musics have this playful ambience. I don’t know why but their first song that I’ve played (Utopiosphere) reminds me of Claris. The difference is that Claris’s songs sounds more mature soundings than Mili’s. I haven't read the lyric much, but I won't be surprised if they have much deeper meanings than what their music suggests. Their next song: “world.execute(me);” managed to make me laugh. That was the first time I’ve heard a song’s lyric about sex and love but being told in ‘geekish’ language mixed by ‘usual’ Japanese-style silliness (“if I’m an eggplant then I’ll give you my nutrients” etc). Overall it’s a cute song but also weird and geekish at the same time. Personally, their music is not my kind of music. It’s an age thing, I guess. But I really appreciate their wild creativity and hope that they can get more exposures especially since they seems to have a lot of English songs - no surprise considering that momocashew, the group’s vocalist, is a trilingual.
